description: multiple states, each with different content. A multi-state box displays one state at a time.
For a tutorial on working with your multi-state box and Velo, click [here](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-tutorial-working-with-multi-state-boxes-and-code).
Get hands-on experience with multi-state box on our [Hello Multi-state Boxes](https://www.wix.com/velo/example/hello-multi-state-boxes) example page.

docs.summary: Gets the multi-state box's current state.

examples.title: Get the current state and its ID

docs.summary: Gets a list of all the states contained in the multi-state box.

params.name: stateReference
params.doc: The state to move to. Either the [`id`]($w.State.html#id) of the state or a [`State`]($w.State.html) object from the multi-state box.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The state that the multi-state box changed to.
Rejected - Error message: If no argument was provided or the argument is not a string or an existing state.

docs.summary: Change the multi-state box's current state to a specific state.
description: The `changeState()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when
the multi-state box finishes moving from the current state to the state
referred to by `stateReference`. `stateReference` can be a state object or
You can retrieve [`State`]($w.State.html) objects to pass to the
`stateReference` parameter from your multi-state box using the
> If you call `changeState()` on a child multi-state box, it doesn't run until the parent box moves to the state where the child box is displayed.

examples.title: Move to a new state using an id
Move to a new state using a [`State`]($w.State.html) object

extra.description: This example moves to the state that is stored in the `state` variable.

examples.title: Move to a new state and log a message when the move is finished

extra.description: This example demonstrates how to switch back and forth between 2 states. The multi-state box has 2 states, with IDs `state1` and `state2`. Each state has a button. When a site visitor clicks the button, the multi-state box moves to the other state.

This example shows how to change between states in multi-state boxes using code. 
 You can test out the code in our [example template](https://manage.wix.com/edit-template/from?originTemplateId=65aa0783-be71-42bc-ac6b-c21b454748f5&templateId=d87fbeb3-300c-49da-b93a-a2a5b4e620c6&autoDevMode=true).

examples.title: State per Status
body: // Get all info on the current product
// If the price is different than the discount price, indicating a sale

extra.description: This example demonstrates how to display different product badges for products on a Wix Stores product page. When a site visitor navigates to a product, we check the product's status (out of stock, on sale) and change the state to display the appropriate badge.

params.name: eventHandler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the multi-state box moves to a new state.

ret.doc: The multi-state box on which the event is now registered.

docs.summary: Adds an event handler that runs when the multi-state box moves to a new state.
description: `onChange` is fired when the multi-state box moves to a new state. This occurs

examples.title: Get the ID of the state to which the multi-state box moved
